oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Homer Geiger to his mother regarding the activities of Battery B
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A letter on YMCA stationary from Geiger to his mother in which he mentions the battery being the leading outfit in the brigade in handling the 75's in the weekly brigade contests. He uses the word "Sammies" to describe American soidiers. Homer Geiger served in Btry. B, 114th Field Art., 30th Div. Btry. B consisted of men from Chattanooga and had previously been a Tennessee National Guard unit. The 30th Div. was composed of National Guard units from Tennessee and the Carolinas.
